heading: fed moves still weigh on market
subheading: concern that the federal reserve will bump up interest rates in the coming months continues to hold us stock markets back.
author: reuters
text: us stocks, particularly technology issues, drifted lower thursday, as uncertainty over long-term interest rates keeping investors on the sidelines. the dow jones industrial average fell 20.65 to 10866.74. the nasdaq composite index dropped 35.17 to 2542.23. and the wired index lost 8.25 to 642.82.in the broader market, advancing issues outnumbered decliners by a 17-to-12 margin.traders said the market lacked conviction on the heels of the federal reserve's decision tuesday to adopt a bias toward tighter monetary policy."people are sitting on sidelines, trying to figure out which way interest rates are going to go," said james volk, co-director of institutional trading at d.a. davidson and co.the benchmark 30-year treasury bond was off 11/32, raising its yield to 5.83 percent.stand-out stocks of the day included etoys (etys), which soared us$57 to $77 after its initial public offering -- a jump that gave the online toy store a bigger market capitalization than toys r us.shares of healtheon (hlth), the pioneer of internet-based health data, jumped $20.38 to $100.63 following news that it would acquire the online medical resource webmd in a $10 billion deal.copyright
